definition: to deprive someone of something, especially by force or theft; commonly used to describe the act of robbing or plundering
examples: Sie haben ihn um sein Geld beraubt.
They robbed him of his money.
Der Dieb hat das Juweliergeschäft beraubt.
The thief robbed the jewelry store.
Die Naturkatastrophe hat sie ihrer Lebensgrundlage beraubt.
The natural disaster deprived them of their livelihood.
He was deprived of his happiness.
Die Krankheit hat ihn seiner Jugend beraubt.
The illness robbed him of his youth.
